nodes.bodyText:
violation message - Empty catch block.(link)
position 11 is for catch token
Problem is code is actually should be placed at {}.
Please do update in code to place first SLIST token from catch.
Such more precise placing will be used in auto-fix functionality to with suggestion on fix.

Issue is block of catch. A catch should always have a block. If we violate on the catch or the block, it all leads to the same area. I would question why auto-fix, when done, couldn't make the same determination.
I don't mind this change and am fine with it.
@romani One area of thought is how this affects xpath. SLIST is a child of LITERAL_CATCH, but this is a slightly breaking change for current xpaths. Some xpaths examine parent/child and this would make those current suppressions not working.
    |      |  `--LITERAL_CATCH -> catch [3:7]
    |      |      |--LPAREN -> ( [3:13]
    |      |      |--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [3:14]
    |      |      |  |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:14]
    |      |      |  |--TYPE -> TYPE [3:14]
    |      |      |  |  `--IDENT -> Exception [3:14]
    |      |      |  `--IDENT -> e [3:24]
    |      |      |--RPAREN -> ) [3:25]
    |      |      `--SLIST -> { [3:27]
    |      |          `--RCURLY -> } [3:28]

Usually good to position violation as close as possible to cause point.
This Check does not support xpath now, it will be supported after this fix.  I am not sure what breaking changes you mention.
It can be ignored. I forgot what this change is doing for us. :)
@gaurabdg , please update code to put violation on braces.

Changes in Inputs are not expected, there more weird Inputs the better. Please keep them as is, if you need such specific cases , please add new code in such files at the end.
the same for others cases like this

But it will throw an error for not finding a corresponding warn comment for SLIST.
Currently the warn comment is on line above lcurly, meaning it corresponds to catch token. Am I understanding it right @romani ?
@gaurabdg Please keep the java code the same, but move the warn comment to the new place where the violation is.
@romani @rnveach I have applied the changes. Please let me know if there's anything else I need to modify.
@romani done, although I could squash the two methods into one. Should it remain like this?

This is not ok to make Checks depends on each other.
You do not need whole method fuctrionality, please create local static method that find SLIST token of catch block.
please inline this code to log(....., no need for method at all
Oh okay, when you earlier mentioned to write a method, I thought it is a good practice. I'll change it right away
